intro: Monnina lanceolata, commonly known as narrowleaf monnina, is an annual herbaceous plant native to North America. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. The plant features slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms. Monnina lanceolata is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
